author: RÃ¡dio e TelevisÃ£o de Portugal
title: Israel diz estar a concluir operaÃ§Ã£o em Khan Yunis e anuncia envio de tropas para Rafah
text:
Israel diz estar a concluir operaÃ§Ã£o em Khan Yunis e anuncia envio de tropas para Rafah
O ministro da Defesa israelita, Yoav Gallant, afirmou hoje que o ExÃ©rcito desmantelou o comando do movimento islamita palestiniano Hamas em Khan Yunis e vai deslocar-se para Rafah, no sul da Faixa de Gaza, para aÃ­ fazer o mesmo.
"A brigada do Hamas em Khan Yunis, que se vangloriou de estar a repelir as ForÃ§as de Defesa de Israel (FDI), estÃ¡ a ser desmantelada, e digo-vos que estamos a concluir a missÃ£o em Khan Yunis e que tambÃ©m chegaremos a Rafah e eliminaremos todos os terroristas que estÃ£o a tentar fazer-nos mal", declarou Gallant durante uma visita Ã  cidade.
Num encontro com militares da 98.Âª DivisÃ£o do ExÃ©rcito israelita, o ministro congratulou-se com o facto de as operaÃ§Ãµes em Khan Yunis "estarem a avanÃ§ar com resultados incrÃ­veis", o que torna a situaÃ§Ã£o cada vez "mais complicada" para os combatentes palestinianos, noticiou o diÃ¡rio The Times of Israel.
"NÃ£o tÃªm armas, nÃ£o tÃªm muniÃ§Ãµes, nÃ£o tem capacidade para tratar os feridos. TÃªm 10.000 terroristas mortos e outros 10.000 feridos que nÃ£o estÃ£o operacionais", asseverou o ministro da Defesa israelita, sublinhando que Israel desferiu um golpe que "corroeu" o poder do Hamas.
Assim, o governante indicou que estas operaÃ§Ãµes israelitas tanto Ã  superfÃ­cie como no subsolo da Faixa de Gaza, e concretamente em Khan Yunis, "aproximam o regresso dos refÃ©ns" mantidos em cativeiro pelo Hamas, que acusou de sÃ³ entender a linguagem da forÃ§a.
A 07 de outubro, combatentes do Movimento de ResistÃªncia IslÃ¢mica (Hamas) -- desde 2007 no poder na Faixa de Gaza e classificado como organizaÃ§Ã£o terrorista pelos Estados Unidos, a UniÃ£o Europeia e Israel -- realizaram em territÃ³rio israelita um ataque de proporÃ§Ãµes sem precedentes desde a criaÃ§Ã£o do Estado de Israel, em 1948, fazendo 1.163 mortos, na maioria civis, e cerca de 250 refÃ©ns, 132 dos quais permanecem em cativeiro, segundo o mais recente balanÃ§o das autoridades israelitas.
Em retaliaÃ§Ã£o, Israel declarou uma guerra para "erradicar" o Hamas, que comeÃ§ou por cortes ao abastecimento de comida, Ã¡gua, eletricidade e combustÃ­vel na Faixa de Gaza e bombardeamentos diÃ¡rios, seguidos de uma ofensiva terrestre ao norte do territÃ³rio, que depois se estendeu ao sul.
A guerra entre Israel e o Hamas, que hoje entrou no 118.Âº dia e continua a ameaÃ§ar alastrar a toda a regiÃ£o do MÃ©dio Oriente, fez atÃ© agora na Faixa de Gaza mais de 27.000 mortos, 67.000 feridos e 8.000 desaparecidos, na maioria civis, de acordo com o Ãºltimo balanÃ§o das autoridades locais, e quase dois milhÃµes de deslocados (mais de 85% dos habitantes), mergulhando o enclave palestiniano sobrepovoado e pobre numa grave crise humanitÃ¡ria, com toda a populaÃ§Ã£o afetada por nÃ­veis graves de fome que jÃ¡ comeÃ§ou a fazer vÃ­timas, segundo a ONU.

author: Kate Noble
title: To Gaza, With Love
text:
This year, the non-stop Israeli bombardment and thousands of lives lost means that Valentineâ€™s day will be a difficult day in Gaza. Bombings have destroyed most properties in Gaza and thousands face imminent famine. People will not be celebrating in ways Gazans have in past years: sharing sweets, Gaza-grown flowers, balloons, and red teddy bears.
We join many throughout the world demanding a cease-fire and continuing our advocacy for an end to Israeli military occupation, apartheid, genocide, and blockade.
Now more than ever we wish to reach Palestinians in Gaza with a message of love, as we work for a day when flowers once again can bloom in Gaza.
How to share your Valentine to Gaza
- Print this graphic, take a photo holding it and share on your social media. Tag @ afsc_org on
TikTok, and use #LoveToGaza.
- Download
this graphicand change your social media profile picture for the month of February and reshare our posts on social media.
Ideas for where to take your photo:
- With your legislator
- At a city landmark or iconic location
- With your congregation/club/class
- At a rally or event
What to do after you send a Valentine
Call on Congress to support an immediate cease-fire in Gaza. Ask your followers to call and write everyday.
- Share about the immediate need for humanitarian aid. Ask your followers to donate to
www.afsc.org/give2gaza.
â€œIf you grew up in [Gaza] Palestine like I did, you knew it was Valentineâ€™s Day season when the best pop songs are released, when everyone on the streets was wearing red, and when all the locally grown roses were nearly sold out. As a little boy, I wasnâ€™t concerned with buying romantic gifts, but I did enjoy the atmosphere and the energy on the streets of Gaza as people took the time to step away from the harsh reality of our surroundings to focus on romance, beauty, and gratitude.â€ Hani Almadhoun, UNRWA-USA, 2020

author: Tim Quitadamo
title: How federal budget cuts are already impacting the Rogue River watershed | Top Stories | kdrv.com
text:
JACKSON COUNTY, Ore. -- "We work on ecological restoration projects for the benefit of wildlife habitat on the one hand, but tremendous community benefits as well," Rogue River Watershed Council Executive Director Brian Barr tells NewsWatch 12. â€œAll of our projects have a positive impact on the water quality in streams like Bear Creek, Elk Creek, Little Butte Creek, and those benefits to water quality run to everyone that uses the river.â€
In 2024, RRWC worked on a habitat restoration project along the Bear Creek greenway in Talent, Ore., an area that was devastated by the Almeda Fire in 2020.
â€œThe total cost of that project was just short of $1 million,â€ Barr says. â€œIt took about four years to develop and a summer to implement. A fairly sizable chunk of that funding came from the United States Forest Service, federal funds that helped us get this work on the ground. This summer we were slated to do seven projects throughout Jackson County. The total price tag of all that work is around $4 million and $2.5 million was tabbed as federal funding and weâ€™re not entirely certain that money is going to be available when we go to do the restoration work.â€
These projects aim to restore habitats by improving water quality, soaking flood plains with water to help creeks and rivers flow in dryer months and creating natural environments that are welcoming for wildlife like salmon, steelhead and more. However, wildlife arenâ€™t the only living beings that benefit from RRWCâ€™s work.
â€œThis water [in Bear Creek] will flow into the Rogue River and down to the cities of Gold Hill, Rogue River and Grants Pass,â€ Barr says. â€œSome portion of this water will get pulled up into the drinking water intakes in those cities and get sent out to folks that rely on drinking water in those towns. Cleaner water impacts you when you turn your faucet on and I really think thatâ€™s one of the things we take for granted when we turn our faucet on.â€
With the funding uncertainty, RRWC is holding off on contracting work for five of the seven projects along the Upper Rogue River this year.
"We have saddled up to our computers and we are writing a lot of proposals right now to foundations and other sources of funding that we haven't really tapped into in the past,â€ Barr explains. â€œWe'll see how our story plays with them."

author: AB Newswire
title: Revolutionizing Hydration On-The-Go: OnTheGo Drinkware Launches Premium Line of Sustainable Portable Devices | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Unfold a Healthier, Greener Tomorrow: OnTheGo Drinkware Redefines Hydration with Style and Sustainability. United Kingdom - OnTheGo Drinkware is proud to unveil its latest line of innovative hydration solutions, designed to revolutionize the way we stay hydrated while promoting sustainability. With a focus on compact, foldable, and convenient designs, OnTheGo Drinkware's portable devices are not just water bottles; they are a lifestyle accessory catering to the health-conscious and environmentally aware consumer.
Introducing OnTheGo Drinkware: Your Go-To Source for Portable Hydration
In a world where staying hydrated is key to overall well-being, OnTheGo Drinkware emerges as a trailblazer, providing a range of premium, sustainable hydration devices. The brand's commitment to health and the environment is encapsulated in its thoughtfully designed products that go beyond mere functionality.
Sustainable Hydration: A Win-Win for Health and the Environment
At the heart of OnTheGo Drinkware's ethos is the belief that hydration should not come at the expense of the planet. The company emphasizes the importance of choosing reusable drinkware, promoting a real win-win scenario where personal health is prioritized alongside positive environmental impact.
The focus on sustainability is evident in OnTheGo Drinkware's star products, the Silicone Foldable Water Bottle and the Foldable Water Bottle. These meticulously crafted devices offer a unique blend of convenience and eco-friendliness. The foldable design ensures easy storage, making them the perfect companions for commuters, hikers, campers, fishing enthusiasts, and travelers.
What Sets OnTheGo Drinkware Apart?
Compact and Foldable Design: The standout feature of OnTheGo Drinkware's products is their compact and foldable design. Unlike traditional water bottles, these devices can be easily folded and stowed away in pockets or handbags after use, eliminating storage concerns.
Convenience for Every Lifestyle: Whether you're on a daily commute, hiking through the great outdoors, camping under the stars, or exploring new destinations, OnTheGo Drinkware ensures that hydration is never compromised. These devices seamlessly integrate into various lifestyles, providing unparalleled convenience.
Sustainability at Its Core: OnTheGo Drinkware is committed to reducing single-use plastic waste. By choosing these reusable and durable devices, consumers actively contribute to a more sustainable and eco-friendly future.
Explore the OnTheGo Difference
Visit OnTheGo Drinkware's website to explore the full range of products and discover why the Silicone Foldable Water Bottle and the Foldable Water Bottle are making waves in the world of portable hydration.
OnTheGo Drinkware is not just a brand; it's a lifestyle choice for those who prioritize health, convenience, and sustainability. Join them in the movement towards a hydrated and eco-conscious future.
About OnTheGo Drinkware:
OnTheGo Drinkware is a brand committed to providing innovative and sustainable hydration solutions. With a range of premium products designed for convenience and eco-friendliness, OnTheGo Drinkware aims to revolutionize the way individuals stay hydrated on-the-go.
